issues.description: The template repository contains a naming/signature mismatch in the array helper method: ArrayHelpers.java in the template defines a method named appendElement(T[], T) but other template classes (Stock.java) call ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). This prevents the template from compiling and confuses students about which helper API to use. The solution repository uses addElementToArray, so the template and solution disagree on the helper method name.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method name consistent across template and solution. Either rename the template ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...) or change calls in Stock.java (and any other callers) to use appendElement(...). Prefer matching the solution API (addElementToArray) so example/solution code aligns with the starter template.

issues.description: The problem statement gives contradictory guidance about initialization of the stock attribute: it first instructs students to initialize both orders and stock in the SealSaloon constructor (instance constructor), but later explicitly requires the stock attribute to be static (shared) and that acceptSupplyDelivery and calculateTotalPrice be static. Initializing a static/shared stock in an instance constructor is confusing and contradicts the later static requirement. The solution implements stock as a static final field initialized at declaration rather than in the constructor.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the problem statement: state that orders (instance field) should be initialized in the instance constructor, while the stock field should be declared static (and may be initialized at declaration or in a static initializer). Explicitly explain that stock is shared across all SealSaloon instances and therefore should not be relied on to be initialized per-instance in the constructor.

issues.description: The helper method for appending an element to an array has different names across artifacts, creating a direct mapping and compilation confusion. In the template repository ArrayHelpers.java the method is named appendElement(...), but other code (template Stock.java and the solution) calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). This inconsistency means students starting from the template will see a call to addElementToArray that does not exist in the provided ArrayHelpers, causing compile errors and extra cognitive burden to reconcile which name is intended.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method name consistent across repositories. Either rename the method in template ArrayHelpers.java from appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...), or change all calls (e.g., in Stock.java) to use appendElement(...). Prefer renaming template ArrayHelpers to addElementToArray(...) to match the solution and existing calls in template Stock.java, ensuring students can compile and map the helper usage without extra confusion.
